org.matsim.core.mobsim.framework

Interface NetworkAgent

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MobsimAgentMarkerInterface
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DriverAgent, MobsimAgent, MobsimDriverAgent, MobsimDriverPassengerAgent, MobsimPassengerAgent, PassengerAgent, PTPassengerAgent, TransitDriverAgent
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTransitDriverAgent, BasicPlanAgentImpl, PersonDriverAgentImpl, PlanBasedDriverAgentImpl, TransitAgent, TransitAgentImpl, TransitDriverAgentImpl

    public interface NetworkAgent
extends MobsimAgentMarkerInterface
    This was separated out since there were some commonalities between "MobsimAgent" and "DriverAgent".
    Author:
    nagel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Id<Link> getCurrentLinkId()
      Design comments: Agent in many situations knows where he/she is.
      Id<Link> getDestinationLinkId()
      Design comments: Originally, agents knew where they were going.
      String getMode()
      Convenience method for Leg.getMode(), in an attempt to get rid of getCurrentLeg().

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentLinkId

        Id<Link> getCurrentLinkId()
        Design comments:
        • Agent in many situations knows where he/she is. If not, return null.
        Returns:
        Id of current link. May be null (e.g. for teleporting agents)

      • getDestinationLinkId

        Id<Link> getDestinationLinkId()
        Design comments:
        • Originally, agents knew where they were going. This was then also used for teleportation. Since then, agents may not know where they are ultimately going. It might thus be more expressive to have "getDestinationLinkId" only for teleporting agents, and have "isArrivingOnCurrentLink" for all others (which would be parallel to how bus passengers handle this). If someone would find this better, and wants to refactor the code, then please go ahead. kai, nov'14
        Returns:
        Id of destination link. May be null (e.g. for cruising taxi drivers)

      • getMode

        String getMode()
        Convenience method for Leg.getMode(), in an attempt to get rid of getCurrentLeg(). If the agent is not on a leg, the behavior of this method is undefined (so don't rely on it).

        Comments:
        • Should be renamed to getLegMode(), in my opinion, as the mode of an agent can be anything else. mrieser/jan'12
        • I don't mind, but my current eclipse can't do the refactoring (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=293861). kai, jan'13
